sections.instructions: Choose the correct letter A, B or C.
sections.title: Study on Gender in Physics

questions.question: The students in Akira Miyake’s study were all majoring in
options: C science, technology, engineering or mathematics

questions.question: The aim of Miyake’s study was to investigate
options: A what kind of women choose to study physics
B a way of improving women’s performance in physics
C whether fewer women than men study physics at college

questions.question: The female physics students were wrong to believe that
options: A the teachers marked them unfairly
B the male students expected them to do badly
C their test results were lower than male students’

questions.question: Miyake’s team asked the students to write about
options: A what they enjoyed about studying physics
B the successful experiences of other people
C something that was important to them personally

questions.question: What was the aim of the writing exercise done by the subjects?
What surprised the researchers about the study?
options: A how few students managed to get A grades
B the positive impact it had on physics results for women
C the difference between male and female performance

questions.question: Greg and Lisa think Miyake’s results could have been affected by
options: A the length of the writing task
B the number of students who took part
C the information the students were given

questions.question: Greg and Lisa decide that in their own project, they will compare the effects of
options: B a writing task with an oral task

questions.question: The main finding of Smolinsky’s research was that class teamwork activities
options: A were most effective when done by all-women groups
B had no effect on the performance of men or women
C improved the results of men more than of women

questions.question: What will Lisa and Greg do next?
options: C look at the science timetable
